meanings.definition: A person or thing that acts as a chief support or part of a group.
meanings.sent1: In our class project, Sarah was the mainstay who kept us organized and on track.
meanings.sent2: The mainstay of the team, John's leadership was crucial for our success.
meanings.sent3: The mainstay of the party, the cake, was accidentally dropped on the floor.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude was the mainstay that held the team together during tough times.
meanings.sent5: The mainstay of the family, Grandma's wisdom guided us through generations.

meanings.definition: The stay that secures the mainmast forward.
meanings.sent1: The sailors checked the mainstay to ensure the mainmast was secure in the storm.
meanings.sent2: The mainstay was tightened to keep the mainmast steady during rough seas.
meanings.sent3: During the storm, the mainstay decided to take a break, leaving the mainmast wobbling.
meanings.sent4: The mainstay held the mainmast like a protective shield against the powerful winds.
meanings.sent5: The mainstay's strength kept the mainmast standing tall amidst the raging ocean.
